metadata.synopsis: Polly Adler (Shelley Winters) runs a 1920s Broadway brothel, backed by a bootlegger (Robert Taylor) and big shots.

reviews: [Polly Adler's book was] an interesting and unpretentious study of an era and its seamy side from a unique view point. No such claims can be made for this movie version of a madam's memoirs.
Poorly and unimaginatively adapted from the autobiography of Polly Adler.
